intro: Sphaerostephanos hirsutus var. celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes hirsute starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Celebes. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hirsute, hairy appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and produces small, star-shaped flowers. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves and a compact, shrub-like growth habit. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
